metadata.synopsis: After years in a mental institution, George (Gene Wilder) is finally released and tries to adapt to life outside of the hospital's walls. Things quickly become eventful for George, however, when he is mistaken for Abe Fielding (also Wilder), a wealthy man who recently vanished. When the shifty Eddie Dash (Richard Pryor) realizes the situation, he decides to seize the opportunity and have George pose as Fielding, resulting in plenty of odd and awkward moments.

reviews: Degenerative illnesses aren't very conducive to comedy...How bad was the movie? It made Gene Wilder quit show business.
The final and worst of the four Gene Wilder-Richard Pryor movies.
Pathetic attempt to recapture the vanished magic of a once-effective comedy team.
Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor have been a brilliant team in the past. Such is so plainly not the case in this awful little misfire.
